[vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Park Guidelines & Rules” font_container=”tag:h1|font_size:36|text_align:center|color:%23022f66″ use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]

Your safety is our top priority! Before you enjoy the fun and thrills of our water park, please take a moment to review the safety restrictions and guidelines for each ride. By following these measures, you can have a safe and enjoyable experience. Thank you for your cooperation!”

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion section_title_tag=”h6″ style=”flat” gap=”5″ c_position=”right” active_section=”1″ no_fill=”true” el_class=”gg_accordion gg_accordion-park”][vc_tta_section title=”Water Wave experiences” tab_id=”1682501546976-6343cf9f-fc2b”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_custom_heading text=”Victoria Waves” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:center|color:%23085282″ use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_single_image image=”1483″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_custom_heading text=”River congo” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:center|color:%23085282″ use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_single_image image=”1170″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

1.4metres – 2 metres[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]WEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

Maximum 40kg – 90kg[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]

WATER DEPTH

~0-1.7 meters

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Not recommended for:

  • The elderly i.e. individuals over 55 years old.
  • Individuals with heart disease, high blood pressure, otitis media or any related condition that could lead to hypertension or heart failure.

Pregnant women are prohibited from entering the water wave experiences

Please do not use if you have:

  • Infectious diseases
  • Skin diseases (e.g. ulcers on the back)
  • Mental illness
  • Open Tuberculosis
  • Severe Trachoma
  • Acute Conjunctivitis
  • Osteoporosis
  • Active menstruation
  • Fear of heights

or any other disabilities or impairments not listed specifically but puts your safety at risk.

No drinking on this ride

Please do not wear slippers or hard items such as:

  • Sunglasses
  • Mobile phones
  • Keys
  • Watches and jewellery (especially hair clips) are not permitted to be worn as you slide down.

Important Notice

  • The water depth in this pool ranges from 0-1.7 meters. Please do not go beyond the warning line. If you are not a strong swimmer, please avoid deep water.
  • In order to ensure the safety of yourself and others, please cooperate with the lifeguard’s management work and avoid diving, underwater swimming, and running or playing
    around the poolside.
  • Please do not stand on the air bubbles.
  • Please do not wear glasses or sunglasses when entering the pool area.
  • Please enter and exit the wave pool from the shallow end (front end).
  • When the water depth in the amusement pool is greater than 0.6 meters, children under 12 years old and under 1.1 meters in height, as well as elderly people, must be accompanied by an adult for supervision and assistance to enter the pool.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Pirates of the Caribbean” tab_id=”1682509449255-2a412f60-d8c7″][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_single_image image=”1171″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

Above 1.2metres

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]WEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

Maximum 85kg

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Not recommended for:

  • The elderly i.e. individuals over 55 years old.
  • Individuals with heart disease, high blood pressure, otitis media or any related condition that could lead to hypertension or heart failure.

Pregnant women are prohibited from entering the pirate ship

Please do not use if you have:

  • Infectious diseases
  • Skin diseases (e.g. ulcers on the back)
  • Mental illness
  • Open Tuberculosis
  • Severe Trachoma
  • Acute Conjunctivitis
  • Osteoporosis
  • Active menstruation
  • Fear of heights
  • Illnesses (such as heart disease, high blood pressure, back and neck joint diseases, etc.), physical discomfort
  • Any other disabilities or impairments not listed specifically but puts your safety at risk

No drinking on this ride

Please do not wear slippers or hard items such as:

  • Sunglasses
  • Mobile phones
  • Keys
  • Watches and jewellery (especially hair clips) are not permitted to be worn as you slide down.

Important Notice

  • Children under one meter in height are not allowed to enter the pirate ship area, including the pool. Some equipment is only suitable for visitors over 1.2 meters in height.
  • Child visitors are not allowed to enter the pirate ship without the permission of the guardian. Children must be accompanied by a guardian when playing.
  • Dangerous behaviour such as climbing guardrails, intentionally damaging equipment, chasing and playing in the pirate ship, etc., is strictly prohibited.
  • Visitors can only enter the ship after receiving instructions and assistance from the guardian. Visitors must not slide prematurely before the guardian issues instructions.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Water House” tab_id=”1682510498365-6252cd54-06bc”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_single_image image=”1613″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

Above 1.2metres

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]WEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

Above 35kg – Max 85kg[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Not recommended for:

  • The elderly i.e. individuals over 55 years old.
  • Individuals with heart disease, high blood pressure, otitis media or any related condition that could lead to hypertension or heart failure.

Pregnant women are prohibited from entering the pirate house

No drinking on this ride

Please do not wear slippers or hard items such as:

  • Sunglasses
  • Mobile phones
  • Keys
  • Watches and jewellery (especially hair clips) are not permitted to be worn as you slide down.

Important Notice

  • Children under 1m tall are not allowed to enter the interactive water house area, including the interactive water pool. Some equipment is only suitable for visitors above 1.2m in height.
  • Child visitors are not allowed to enter the slide without the permission of the guardian. Children must be accompanied by a guardian when playing.
  • Dangerous behaviour such as climbing guardrails, intentionally damaging equipment, chasing and playing in the water house, etc., is strictly prohibited. Visitors are not allowed to climb the slide in reverse.
  • Visitors must maintain a safe posture while sliding and must not perform any dangerous actions.
  • After sliding, visitors should follow the instructions of staff and leave the slide on the specified direction. Lingering in the slide is not allowed.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”The Rainbow” tab_id=”1682510995842-7ae7145b-5d44″][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_single_image image=”1175″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS

  • Individuals with heart disease, high blood pressure, otitis media or any related condition that could lead to hypertension or heart failure.

Pregnant women are prohibited from entering the Rainbow

Please do not use if you have:

  • Infectious diseases
  • Skin diseases (e.g. ulcers on the back)
  • Mental illness
  • Open Tuberculosis
  • Severe Trachoma
  • Acute Conjunctivitis
  • Osteoporosis
  • Active menstruation
  • Fear of heights
  • Illnesses (such as heart disease, high blood pressure, back and neck joint diseases, etc.), physical discomfort
  • Any other disabilities or impairments not listed specifically but puts your safety at risk

No drinking on this ride

Please do not wear slippers or hard items such as:

  • Sunglasses
  • Mobile phones
  • Keys
  • Watches and jewellery (especially hair clips) are not permitted to be worn as you slide down.

Important Notice

  • When using the equipment, you must obey the instructions of the on-site staff and carry it out under the guidance of the staff.
  • Child visitors are not allowed to enter the slide without the permission of the guardian. Children must be accompanied by a guardian when playing.
  • The passenger must lie forward on the sliding blanket, hold the handrail of the sliding blanket with both hands, keep the elbows at shoulder level, and lay the legs flat or crossed, and the operator will push and slide down. Hold the handle of the slide blanket firmly during sliding, and never let go or change other postures.
  • Only one passenger per slide is allowed to slide down at a time, and the next occupant can only slide down after the previous passenger leaves the buffer tank.
  • Passengers must read the “Instructions for Passengers” carefully before riding, and do not climb over the fence when getting on and off the platform.
  • Before sliding, passengers must wait outside the safety red line.
  • Do not climb over the fence when getting on and off the platform.
  • In case of strong winds or thunderstorms, this slide will be temporarily closed. Please leave the platform quickly and take shelter in the rest pavillion.

Above 75kg[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Sliding Posture Instructions

The occupant lies flat on the slide, raises his head, holds his head or shoulders with his hands, lays his legs flat or crossed, and the operator pushes the occupant’s shoulders to slide down and do not let go or let go during the slide or change to other poses.

Not recommended for:

  • Pregnant women.

  • Any other disabilities or impairments not listed specifically but puts your safety at risk

  • Sunglasses
  • Mobile phones
  • Keys
  • Watches and jewellery (especially hair clips) are not permitted to be worn as you slide down.

Important Notice

  • When using the equipment, you must obey the instructions of the on-site staff and carry it out under the guidance of the staff.
  • Only one visitor is allowed per time, the next one can exit the slide after previous visitor leaves the buffer tank.
  • Passengers must read the “Instructions for Passengers” carefully before riding, and do not climb over the fence when getting on and off the platform.
  • Before sliding, passengers must wait outside the safety red line.
  • Do not climb over the fence when getting on and off the platform.
  • In case of strong winds or thunderstorms, this slide will be temporarily closed. Please leave the platform quickly and take shelter in the rest pavilion

Maximum 45kg – 85kg[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Passengers hold their heads or cross their chests with their hands, put their legs flat or crossed, stand at the entrance of the space capsule on the platform, and slide into the chute by opening the standing board instantly, and do not change other postures during the sliding process.
